intro: Senecio georgianus, commonly known as the Georgian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Senecio georgianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
